title: Adding Linkouts
text: add linkouts, specify axis type chmAddAxisType(). demo data example, row labels correspond genes, specified HUGO gene symbols. column labels full 28-character TCGA aliquot barcodes.
code: hm <- chmNew("tcga-brca", matrix_data) hm <- chmAddAxisType(hm, "row", "bio.gene.hugo") hm <- chmAddAxisType(hm, "column", "bio.tcga.barcode.sample.vial.portion.analyte.aliquot")

title: Adding Linkouts
text: available axis types : bio.gene.entrezid: NCBI Entrez Gene Identifier bio.gene.hugo: HUGO gene symbol bio.geo.acc: GEO accession id bio.go: Gene Ontology accession identifier bio.mdacc.pathwayid: PathwaysWeb pathway identifier bio.mirna: miRNA identifier bio.pathway.msigdb.name: msig DB pathway name bio.protein.uniprotid: Uniprot protein identifier bio.pubmed: PubMed identifier bio.tcga.barcode.sample: First 15 characters TCGA aliquot barcode bio.tcga.barcode.sample.vial: First 16 characters TCGA aliquot barcode bio.tcga.barcode.sample.vial.portion: First 19 characters TCGA aliquot barcode bio.tcga.barcode.sample.vial.portion.analyte: First 20 characters TCGA aliquot barcode bio.tcga.barcode.sample.vial.portion.analyte.aliquot: Full 28 character TCGA aliquot barcode bio.transcript.ensembl: Ensembl transcript identifier bio.transcriptid: Entrez transcription identifier scholar: Google Scholar search term search: Generic search term Back top

title: Color Maps
text: function chmNewColorMap() creates new color map. continuous color map, first argument list breakpoints. Breakpoints must unique numbers ascending numerical order. TCGA BRCA Expression demo data, reasonable breakpoints 6.4, 10, 14. second argument corresponding list colors breakpoints. colors can specified name standard colors, hexadecimal code. order use color map matrix data NG-CHM, data layer created chmNewDataLayer(), used chmNew() shown : Back top
code: colorMap <- chmNewColorMap(c(6.4, 10, 14), c("steelblue", "antiquewhite", "firebrick")) # or with equivalent hexadecimal codes: colorMap <- chmNewColorMap(c(6.4, 10, 14), c("#4682B4", "#FAEBD7", "#B22222")) dataLayer <- chmNewDataLayer("TCGA BRCA Expression", matrix_data, colorMap) hm <- chmNew("TCGA BRCA Expression", dataLayer)

title: Color Maps
text: chmNewColorMap() function also creates discrete color maps. first argument list unique values data, second argument list colors. Standard color names hexadecimal codes can used. chmNewCovariate() function, optional third argument color map: Back top
code: mutationColorMap <- chmNewColorMap(c("WT", "MUT"), c("lightsteelblue3", "khaki3")) ## or with equivalent hexadecimal codes: mutationColorMap <- chmNewColorMap(c("WT", "MUT"), c("#A2B5CD", "#CDC673")) covariateBar <- chmNewCovariate("TP53 Mutation (other colors)", covariate_vector, mutationColorMap)

title: Color Maps
text: complete code block example, followed resulting NG-CHM: Back top
code: library(NGCHMDemoData) library(NGCHMSupportFiles) library(NGCHM) matrix_data_file <- system.file("extdata", "TCGA.BRCA.Expression.csv", package = "NGCHMDemoData") matrix_data <- as.matrix(read.csv(matrix_data_file, header = TRUE, row.names = 1, check.names = FALSE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)) covariate_data_file <- system.file("extdata", "TCGA.BRCA.TP53Mutation.csv", package = "NGCHMDemoData") covariate_data <- as.matrix(read.csv(covariate_data_file, row.names = 1, check.names = FALSE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)) covariate_vector <- as.vector(covariate_data) # create vector of mutation data names(covariate_vector) <- rownames(covariate_data) # set the names colorMap <- chmNewColorMap(c(6.4, 10, 14), c("steelblue", "antiquewhite", "firebrick")) dataLayer <- chmNewDataLayer("TCGA BRCA Expression", matrix_data, colorMap) hm <- chmNew("TCGA BRCA Expression Heatmap", dataLayer) mutationColorMap <- chmNewColorMap(c("WT", "MUT"), c("lightsteelblue3", "khaki3")) covariateBar <- chmNewCovariate("TP53 Mutation", covariate_vector, mutationColorMap) hm <- chmAddCovariateBar(hm, "column", covariateBar) chmExportToHTML(hm, "colormap.html", overwrite = TRUE) htmltools::tags$iframe(src = "colormap.html", width = "100%", height = 700)

title: Data Layers
text: function chmNewDataLayer() creates data layer. first argument desired name data layer, second argument matrix data, third argument color map. example creates color map data layer TCGA BRCA Expression data. See Color Maps information creating color maps. second data layer, data row centered. code block row-centers data, creates color map, creates second data layer row-centered data. NG-CHM can created data layers: Back top
code: dataColorMap <- chmNewColorMap(c(6.4, 10, 14), c("mediumblue", "snow", "firebrick")) dataLayer <- chmNewDataLayer("Unadjusted", matrix_data, dataColorMap) rowCenteredData <- t(scale(t(matrix_data))) rowCenteredColorMap <- chmNewColorMap(c(-2, 0, 2), c("#9933ff", "#f0f0f0", "#228B22")) rowCenteredLayer <- chmNewDataLayer("Row-Centered", rowCenteredData, rowCenteredColorMap) hm <- chmNew("TCGA BRCA Expression", dataLayer, rowCenteredLayer)

title: Data Layers
text: full code block resulting NG-CHM. resulting NG-CHM two data layers available. toggle layers, click   icon (first 4 buttons upper right side). Back top
code: library(NGCHMDemoData) library(NGCHMSupportFiles) library(NGCHM) matrix_data_file <- system.file("extdata", "TCGA.BRCA.Expression.csv", package = "NGCHMDemoData") matrix_data <- as.matrix(read.csv(matrix_data_file, header = TRUE, row.names = 1, check.names = FALSE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)) covariate_data_file <- system.file("extdata", "TCGA.BRCA.TP53Mutation.csv", package = "NGCHMDemoData") covariate_data <- as.matrix(read.csv(covariate_data_file, row.names = 1, check.names = FALSE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)) covariate_vector <- as.vector(covariate_data) # create vector of mutation data names(covariate_vector) <- rownames(covariate_data) # set the names dataColorMap <- chmNewColorMap(c(6.4, 10, 14), c("mediumblue", "snow", "firebrick")) dataLayer <- chmNewDataLayer("Unadjusted", matrix_data, dataColorMap) rowCenteredData <- t(scale(t(matrix_data))) rowCenteredColorMap <- chmNewColorMap(c(-2, 0, 2), c("#9933ff", "#f0f0f0", "#228B22")) rowCenteredLayer <- chmNewDataLayer("Row-Centered", rowCenteredData, rowCenteredColorMap) hm <- chmNew("TCGA BRCA Expression", dataLayer, rowCenteredLayer) chmExportToHTML(hm, "datalayers.html", overwrite = TRUE) htmltools::tags$iframe(src = "datalayers.html", width = "100%", height = 700)

title: Getting Started
text: two code examples. first uses NGCHMDemoData create NG-CHM export HTML .ngchm files. second performs task generic code containing placeholders user-specific data files, covariate column names, variables. Back top Back top
code: library(NGCHMDemoData) library(NGCHMSupportFiles) library(NGCHM) matrix_data_file <- system.file("extdata", "TCGA.BRCA.Expression.csv", package = "NGCHMDemoData") matrix_data <- as.matrix(read.csv(matrix_data_file, header = TRUE, row.names = 1, check.names = FALSE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)) covariate_data_file <- system.file("extdata", "TCGA.BRCA.TP53Mutation.csv", package = "NGCHMDemoData") covariate_data <- read.csv(covariate_data_file, row.names = 1, check.names = FALSE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE) # read.csv returns a data.frame covariate_vector <- covariate_data[["MutationState"]] # create vector names(covariate_vector) <- rownames(covariate_data) # set the names hm <- chmNew("TCGA BRCA Expression", matrix_data) covariateBar <- chmNewCovariate("TP53 Mutation", covariate_vector) hm <- chmAddCovariateBar(hm, "column", covariateBar) chmExportToHTML(hm, "tcga-brca.html", overwrite = TRUE) chmExportToFile(hm, "tcga-brca.ngchm", overwrite = TRUE) library(NGCHMSupportFiles) library(NGCHM) # In the command below, replace "<path to your matrix data file>" with the path to your matrix data file. matrix_data_file <- "<path to your matrix data file>" matrix_data <- as.matrix(read.csv(matrix_data_file, header = TRUE, row.names = 1, check.names = FALSE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)) # In the command below, replace "<path to your covariate data file>" with the path to your covariate data file. covariate_data_file <- "<path to your covariate data file>" covariate_data <- read.csv(covariate_data_file, row.names = 1, stringsAsFactors = FALSE) # read.csv returns a data.frame # In the command below, replace "<covariate column name>" with the name of the column in your covariate data file. covariate_vector <- covariate_data[["<covariate column name>"]] # create vector names(covariate_vector) <- rownames(covariate_data) # set the names # In the command below, replace "<name of your NG-CHM>" with the desired name of your NG-CHM. hm <- chmNew("<name of your NG-CHM>", matrix_data) # In the command below, replace "<name of your covariate>" with the desired name of your covariate. covariateBar <- chmNewCovariate("<name of your covariate>", covariate_vector) hm <- chmAddCovariateBar(hm, "column", covariateBar) # In the command below, replace "<name of your HTML file>" with the desired name of your HTML file. chmExportToHTML(hm, "<name of your HTML file>", overwrite = TRUE) # In the command below, replace "<name of your .ngchm file>" with the desired name of your .ngchm file. # IMPORTANT: The filename must end with '.ngchm' in order to open in the NG-CHM Viewer chmExportToFile(hm, "<name of your .ngchm file>", overwrite = TRUE)

title: Getting Started
text: use NGCHM package, data must formatted : heat map data matrix rownames colnames least one name row/column covariate data vector must row/column names heat map matrix. example uses NGCHMDemoData package, can installed R-Universe repository. NGCHMDemoData includes matrix gene expression data containing 3437 genes (rows) 200 samples (columns) breast cancer data Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA). converted matrix constructing NG-CHM. TCGA.BRCA.Expression.csv snippet IMPORTANT: order used basis NG-CHM, matrix rownames colnames. NGCHMDemoData also includes vector TP35 mutation status TCGA samples matrix. data used construct covariate bar. TCGA.BRCA.TP53Mutation.csv snippet IMPORTANT: order used basis row/column covariate bar, data formatted named vector least one name common row/column names matrix. NGCHMDemoData package includes datasets .csv files. code example, matrix data read TCGA.BRCA.Expression.csv file (NGCHMDemoData package), formatted matrix. mutation data read TCGA.BRCA.TP53Mutation.csv file, formatted named vector. Back top
code: library(NGCHMDemoData) # Read in the NGCHMDemoData expression data, and format as a matrix matrix_data_file <- system.file("extdata", "TCGA.BRCA.Expression.csv", package = "NGCHMDemoData") matrix_data <- as.matrix(read.csv(matrix_data_file, header = TRUE, row.names = 1, check.names = FALSE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)) # Read in the NGCHMDemoData mutation data, and format as a named vector covariate_data_file <- system.file("extdata", "TCGA.BRCA.TP53Mutation.csv", package = "NGCHMDemoData") covariate_data <- read.csv(covariate_data_file, row.names = 1, check.names = FALSE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE) # read.csv returns a data.frame covariate_vector <- covariate_data[["MutationState"]] # create vector names(covariate_vector) <- rownames(covariate_data) # set the names

title: Ordering and Clustering
text: function chmNew() optional arguments “rowOrder” “colOrder” specify order rows columns, respectively. Values arguments can vector, dendrogram, function specifying order rows/columns. example, following code block creates NG-CHM rows sorted alphabetically columns ordered randomly:
code: rowOrder <- sort(rownames(matrix_data)) colOrder <- colnames(matrix_data)[sample.int(length(colnames(matrix_data)))] hm <- chmNew("tcga-brca", matrix_data, rowOrder = rowOrder, colOrder = colOrder)

title: Ordering and Clustering
text: hierarchical clustering, additional options available specify distance measure clustering method. arguments chmNew() ‘rowDist’ ‘colDist’ specify distance measure rows columns, respectively. available choices include stats::dist() function, well two additional distance metric options: ‘cosine’ ‘correlation’. default choice ‘correlation’, computes distance measure 1 minus Pearson correlation among rows/columns. Arguments ‘rowAgglom’ ‘colAgglom’ specify clustering method, available options stats::hclust function. default ‘ward.D2’. example specifies NG-CHM hierarchical clustering using Euclidean distance metric complete linkage clustering algorithm rows columns: Back top
code: hm <- chmNew("tcga-brca", matrix_data, rowDist = "euclidean", colDist = "euclidean", rowAgglom = "complete", colAgglom = "complete")

title: Ordering and Clustering
text: Clustering may performed explicitly (e.g. via stats::hclust()) used constructing NG-CHM. following creates object class hclust distance matrix demo expression data, rows columns, uses clustering results construct NG-CHM. Similarly, hclust object can transformed dendrogram used row /column ordering. example uses clustering results dendrograms: Back top
code: rowClust <- stats::hclust(dist(matrix_data)) colClust <- stats::hclust(dist(t(matrix_data))) hm <- chmNew("tcga-brca", matrix_data, rowOrder = rowClust, colOrder = colClust) rowDendrogram <- as.dendrogram(stats::hclust(dist(matrix_data))) colDendrogram <- as.dendrogram(stats::hclust(dist(t(matrix_data)))) hm <- chmNew("tcga-brca", matrix_data, rowOrder = rowDendrogram, colOrder = colDendrogram)

title: UMAP
text: code block reads NGCHMDemoData, performs principal component analysis (PCA), calculates UMAP coordinates principal components. vignette uses umap R package must installed order run code . (See Getting Started details creating NG-CHMs). static plot UMAP coordinates, colored TP53 mutation state displayed Figure 1. PCA performed first yielded better group separation compared performing UMAP raw data. Figure 1. UMAP plot TCGA BRCA data colored TP53 mutation state Back top
code: # Read in NGCHMDemoData (as in the Getting Started vignette) library(NGCHMDemoData) matrix_data_file <- system.file("extdata", "TCGA.BRCA.Expression.csv", package = "NGCHMDemoData") matrix_data <- as.matrix(read.csv(matrix_data_file, header = TRUE, row.names = 1, check.names = FALSE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)) covariate_data_file <- system.file("extdata", "TCGA.BRCA.TP53Mutation.csv", package = "NGCHMDemoData") covariate_data <- read.csv(covariate_data_file, row.names = 1, check.names = FALSE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE) # read.csv returns a data.frame covariate_vector <- covariate_data[["MutationState"]] # create vector names(covariate_vector) <- rownames(covariate_data) # set the names # Calculate principal components pca_data <- prcomp(as.data.frame(t(matrix_data)), scale = TRUE, center = TRUE, rank = 10) # Calculate UMAP from principal components library(umap) config <- umap::umap.defaults config$n_neighbors <- 15 # change default for better group separation config$random_state <- 123 # set random state for reproducibility umap_data <- umap::umap(pca_data$x, config = config) # Create static plot of UMAP coordinates colored by TP53 mutation state par(mar = c(4, 4, 4, 8) + 0.1, bg = "white", mgp = c(0.5, 1, 0)) xlim <- range(umap_data$layout[,1]) ylim <- range(umap_data$layout[,2]) plot(xlim, ylim,      xlab = "UMAP 1",      ylab = "UMAP 2",      main = "UMAP",      type = "n", xaxt = "n", yaxt = "n") labels_for_point_color <- as.factor(covariate_vector) # "MUT' and "WT" colors <- c("#f7ef81", "#ffc2e2") # plot only needs two colors: one for "MUT" and one for "WT" points(umap_data$layout[,1], umap_data$layout[,2],        col = colors[as.integer(labels_for_point_color)],        pch = 19, cex = 1.5) legend(x = xlim[2] + (xlim[2] - xlim[1]) * 0.1, # calculate x position for legend        y = ylim[2], # calculate y position for legend        legend = as.character(unique(labels_for_point_color)),        col = colors[as.integer(unique(labels_for_point_color))],        title = "TP53 Mutation State",        inset = 0.03, xpd = TRUE, bty = "n", pch = 19, cex = 0.85)

title: Initialization of the NGCHM library. — NGCHM-initialization
text: configuration directory configuration path, NGCHM package reads contents configuration files conf.d subdirectory order (determined R sort function).  subdirectories scanned unless instructed entry configuration file. Configuration files may either text files (.txt extension), R scripts (.R extension), javascript files (.js extension). example directory structruce server named 'my_server': contents example 00-servers.txt file: contents example config.txt file:
code: . |-- conf.d |   \-- 00-servers.txt \-- my_server     \-- config.txt [servers] my-server = /usr/local/ngchm/my_server serverProtocol = shaidy accessMethod = api basePath = <URL to server. e.g. "https://mydomain.edu/server/api"> serverURL = <URL to server. e.g. "https://mydomain.edu/server">

title: Initialization of the NGCHM library. — NGCHM-initialization
text: text configuration file consists one sections.  section begins single line containing section type enclosed square brackets. Subsequent lines section either blank contain definition form "name separator value". default separator equals sign (=). 'servers' section defines available servers.  name field defines name server known library.  value field specifies directory containing specification server's properties.  server specification directory must contain config.txt contains lines form "name separator value".  config.txt file must define value 'serverProtocol' name ngchmServerProtocol.  must also define values mandatory parameters required ngchmServerProtocol, may optionally define optional parameters.

code: # Examples using `chmNew()` require git to be installed. # The NGCHMSupportFiles package is required by chmExportToFile and chmExportToPDF # The NGCHMDemoData package is used to create a demo NGCHM if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   if (requireNamespace("NGCHMSupportFiles", quietly = TRUE)) {     if (requireNamespace("NGCHMDemoData", quietly = TRUE)) {       library(NGCHMSupportFiles)       library(NGCHMDemoData)       data(TCGA.GBM.EXPR, package = "NGCHMDemoData")       chm1 <- chmNew("gbm", TCGA.GBM.EXPR[1:50, 1:50],         rowAxisType = "bio.gene.hugo",         colAxisType = "bio.tcga.barcode.sample.vial.portion.analyte.aliquot"       )       chmExportToFile(chm1, tempfile("gbm", fileext = ".ngchm"))       chmExportToPDF(chm1, tempfile("gbm", fileext = ".pdf"))     }   }   mat <- matrix(rnorm(100), nrow = 10)   rownames(mat) <- sprintf("ABCA%d", 1:10)   colnames(mat) <- sprintf("Sample%d", 1:10)   chm <- chmNew("my-chm", mat) } # }

title: Add PCA coordinates to an NG-CHM. — chmAddPCA
code: # Examples using `chmNew()` require git to be installed. if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # If the NGCHMDemoData package is installed, use it to demo usage   if (requireNamespace("NGCHMDemoData", quietly = TRUE)) {    data(TCGA.GBM.EXPR, package = "NGCHMDemoData")     prc <- prcomp(TCGA.GBM.EXPR[1:50, 1:50])     hm <- chmNew("gbm", TCGA.GBM.EXPR[1:50, 1:50])     hm <- chmAddPCA(hm, "column", prc)   }   # Small example not requiring NGCHMDemoData   matrix <- matrix(rnorm(100),     nrow = 10, ncol = 10,     dimnames = list(paste0("r", 1:10), paste0("c", 1:10))   )   prc <- prcomp(matrix)   hm <- chmNew("Demo PCA", matrix)   hm <- chmAddPCA(hm, "column", prc) } # }

text: One hidden covariate bar added coordinate obtained obj. specified, maxDim limits maximum number covariate bars added chm. Coordinates names 'BASENAME.coordinate.N', BASENAME specified parameter basename (defaults dimName omitted) N ranges 1 number added covariate bars. obj can numeric matrix, column (reduced) dimension.  case, dimName dimAxis used obtaining reduced dimension.  number rows matrix must equal size specified NGCHM axis row matrix must uniquely named using names axis NG-CHM. obj can also instance class className exists S3 method getDimensions.className. method takes object first parameter two optional parameters, dimName dimAxis, can used specify desired dimension.  method's return value matrix similar one described preceding paragraph.  package defines methods classes prcomp umap.

title: Add reduced dimension coordinates to an NG-CHM. — chmAddReducedDim
code: # Examples using `chmNew()` require git to be installed. if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   if (requireNamespace("NGCHMDemoData", quietly = TRUE)) {     data(TCGA.GBM.EXPR, package = "NGCHMDemoData")     mat <- TCGA.GBM.EXPR[1:10, 1:10]     prc <- prcomp(mat)     hm <- chmNew("Demo reduced dimension coordinates", mat)     hm <- chmAddReducedDim(hm, "column", prc, "PCA", 3, "PC")     umc <- umap::umap(t(mat), n_neighbors = 8)     hm <- chmAddReducedDim(hm, "column", umc, "UMAP")   }   # Small example not requiring NGCHMDemoData   matrix <- matrix(rnorm(100),     nrow = 10, ncol = 10,     dimnames = list(paste0("r", 1:10), paste0("c", 1:10))   )   prc <- prcomp(matrix)   hm <- chmNew("Demo reduced dimension coordinates", matrix)   hm <- chmAddReducedDim(hm, "column", prc, "PCA", 3, "PC")   umc <- umap::umap(t(matrix), n_neighbors = 8)   hm <- chmAddReducedDim(hm, "column", umc, "UMAP") } # }

code: # Examples using  `chmNew()` require git to be installed. if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # If the NGCHMDemoData package is installed, use it to demo usage   if (requireNamespace("NGCHMDemoData", quietly = TRUE)) {     data(TCGA.GBM.EXPR, package = "NGCHMDemoData")     mat <- TCGA.GBM.EXPR[1:10, 1:10]     rtc <- Rtsne::Rtsne(t(mat), check_duplicates = FALSE, perplexity = 3)     hm <- chmNew("gbm", mat)     hm <- chmAddTSNE(hm, "column", rtc, colnames(mat))   }   # Small example not requiring NGCHMDemoData   matrix <- matrix(rnorm(100),     nrow = 10, ncol = 10,     dimnames = list(paste0("r", 1:10), paste0("c", 1:10))   )   rtc <- Rtsne::Rtsne(t(matrix), check_duplicates = FALSE, perplexity = 3)   hm <- chmNew("Demo TSNE", matrix)   hm <- chmAddTSNE(hm, "column", rtc, colnames(matrix)) } # }

code: # If the NGCHMDemoData package is installed, use it to create demo usage if (requireNamespace("NGCHMDemoData", quietly = TRUE)) {   data(TCGA.GBM.Demo, package = "NGCHMDemoData")   dataset <- chmNewDataset("gbmexpr", "TCGA GBM Expression Data", TCGA.GBM.ExpressionData)   dataset <- chmAddCovariate(     dataset, "column",     chmNewCovariate("TP53 Mutation", TCGA.GBM.TP53MutationData)   )   tp53_mutation <- chmCovariate(dataset, "TP53 Mutation") } # Small example not requiring NGCHMDemoData matrix <- matrix(rnorm(100),   nrow = 10, ncol = 10,   dimnames = list(paste0("r", 1:10), paste0("c", 1:10)) ) dataset <- chmNewDataset("Demo", "Random Demo Dataset", matrix) covariate <- setNames(rnorm(10), colnames(matrix)) dataset <- chmAddCovariate(dataset, "column", chmNewCovariate("Random Covariate", covariate)) random_covariate <- chmCovariate(dataset, "Random Covariate")

code: # If the NGCHMDemoData package is installed, use demo usage if (requireNamespace("NGCHMDemoData", quietly = TRUE)) {   data(TCGA.GBM.Demo, package = "NGCHMDemoData")   matrix <- TCGA.GBM.ExpressionData[1:50, 1:50]   hm <- chmNew("New Heat Map")   chmLayer(hm, "Layer 1") <- matrix   chmLayer(hm, 1, cuts_color = "#fefefe") <- chmNewDataLayer("New data layer", matrix + 1) } # Small example not requiring NGCHMDemoData matrix <- matrix(rnorm(100),   nrow = 10, ncol = 10,   dimnames = list(paste0("r", 1:10), paste0("c", 1:10)) ) hm <- chmNew("New Heat Map") chmLayer(hm, "Layer 1") <- matrix chmLayer(hm, 1, cuts_color = "#fefefe") <- chmNewDataLayer("New data layer", matrix + 1)
